['', 'We are very collaborative; you will likely get lots of ideas from the team.', 'Stays up to date with the latest models and changes in the technology', 'Our locomotives stream 350+ sensor information in real-time. We create predictive models to predict various component failures hours, days, and sometimes months in advance.There are high-frame cameras beside our tracks, capturing images of trains and rail cars as they pass. We design various Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms to detect certain objects of interest or issues and defects. We then optimize their performance and deploy them at the edge for real-time scoring and notification of our mechanical personnel upon detections.Want to learn more? Apply today!', 'What will be your duties?', 'We use Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, and MXNet for Deep Learning, and OpenCV for traditional Computer Vision.', 'Evaluate accuracy and quality of data sources, as well as the designed models', 'Minimum of 1 year of relevant industry experience (as a Data Scientist, Research Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, etc.), 2+ preferred; or proven qualifications.', 'We use Python, R, and Spark (PySpark, SparkR) for modeling and EDA.You will have a local machine with 512GB of memory, so feel free to load the data in memory if it makes sense or if it fits (!)You will also have terabytes of memory in our Spark cluster that is not shared by anyone.We use Jupyter notebook, Emacs, PyCharm, Rstudio as IDEs.We use Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, and MXNet for Deep Learning, and OpenCV for traditional Computer Vision.We always have the latest versions of our tools/packages/libraries available.', 'Most of our models make it to production, they never sit in a research lab. But we also do quite a bit of research to stay up to date with the latest technologies/algorithms.', 'We use Python, R, and Spark (PySpark, SparkR) for modeling and EDA.', 'Who we are and what we do:', 'What kind of problems do we solve?', 'knowledge of Spark (PySpark and SparkR) is a plus', 'What are our requirements?', 'What tools do we use?', 'We work with various product teams across various business units to define high-impact business problems, solve them using novel techniques, and execute and monitor them throughout their lifecycle.', 'Communicate results to colleagues and business partners.', 'Excellent knowledge of Python and/or R', 'Hands-on and theoretical knowledge of various Machine Learning algorithms and tools, e.g. xgboost/LightGBM, Random Forests, SVMs, PCA, t-sne, kmeans, DBSCAN, etc.', 'Expertise with Time Series problems is a plus', 'Effectively utilize appropriate statistical, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning models and techniques to solve various business problems', 'Our locomotives stream 350+ sensor information in real-time. We create predictive models to predict various component failures hours, days, and sometimes months in advance.', 'Effectively utilize appropriate statistical, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning models and techniques to solve various business problemsCollaborate with various departments to identify opportunities for process improvement and developing analytics use-cases.Evaluate accuracy and quality of data sources, as well as the designed modelsStays up to date with the latest models and changes in the technologyCommunicate results to colleagues and business partners.', 'The AI and Data Science team is centralized across the entire organization.We work with various product teams across various business units to define high-impact business problems, solve them using novel techniques, and execute and monitor them throughout their lifecycle.Most of our models make it to production, they never sit in a research lab. But we also do quite a bit of research to stay up to date with the latest technologies/algorithms.We are very collaborative; you will likely get lots of ideas from the team.', 'Bachelor’s, Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, Statistics or related field', 'The AI and Data Science team is centralized across the entire organization.', 'Bachelor’s, Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, Statistics or related fieldMinimum of 1 year of relevant industry experience (as a Data Scientist, Research Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, etc.), 2+ preferred; or proven qualifications.Hands-on and theoretical knowledge of various Machine Learning algorithms and tools, e.g. xgboost/LightGBM, Random Forests, SVMs, PCA, t-sne, kmeans, DBSCAN, etc.Expertise with Time Series problems is a plusExcellent knowledge of Python and/or Rknowledge of Spark (PySpark and SparkR) is a plus', '\xa0', 'Collaborate with various departments to identify opportunities for process improvement and developing analytics use-cases.', 'We always have the latest versions of our tools/packages/libraries available.', 'We use Jupyter notebook, Emacs, PyCharm, Rstudio as IDEs.', 'You will also have terabytes of memory in our Spark cluster that is not shared by anyone.', 'There are high-frame cameras beside our tracks, capturing images of trains and rail cars as they pass. We design various Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms to detect certain objects of interest or issues and defects. We then optimize their performance and deploy them at the edge for real-time scoring and notification of our mechanical personnel upon detections.', 'You will have a local machine with 512GB of memory, so feel free to load the data in memory if it makes sense or if it fits (!)', 'Want to learn more? Apply today!']

['', 'REST and RPC API development experience\xa0', 'DropWizard Experience required', '1+ years of industry Java experience\xa0DropWizard Experience requiredREST and RPC API development experience\xa0Experience with SQL databases, constructing schemas, performing migrations, writing analytical queriesSelf-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently and manage multiple projects under minimal supervisionKubernetes, Docker or other container system experience is a plusGoogle Cloud experience is a plusSome quantitative skills, knowledge or experience in finance is a plus', 'Experience with SQL databases, constructing schemas, performing migrations, writing analytical queries', 'Your qualifications', '1+ years of industry Java experience\xa0', 'Our client is looking for a backend engineer to help us scale their next-gen consumer finance platform to millions of users in the next year.', 'Self-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently and manage multiple projects under minimal supervision', 'Some quantitative skills, knowledge or experience in finance is a plus', 'Kubernetes, Docker or other container system experience is a plus', 'Google Cloud experience is a plus']

['', 'Build out and operate our foundational data infrastructure: storage (cloud data warehouse, S3 data lake), orchestration (Airflow), processing (Spark, Flink), streaming services (AWS Kinesis & Kafka), BI tools (Looker & Redash), graph database, and real-time large scale event aggregation store.', 'Experience with AWS, and especially EMR, S3, Glue, Kinesis, IAM', ' Build out and operate our foundational data infrastructure: storage (cloud data warehouse, S3 data lake), orchestration (Airflow), processing (Spark, Flink), streaming services (AWS Kinesis & Kafka), BI tools (Looker & Redash), graph database, and real-time large scale event aggregation store. Build the next iteration of our ingestion pipeline for scale, speed, and reliability. Read from a variety of upstream systems (MongoDB, Postgres, DynamoDB, MySQL, APIs), in both batch and streaming fashion, including change data capture. Make it self-service for non-engineers. Build and evolve the tools that empower colleagues across the company to access data and build reliable and scalable transformations. This includes UIs and simple frameworks for derived tables and dimensional modeling, APIs and caching layers for high-throughput serving, and SDKs for the orchestration of complex Spark and Flink pipelines. Build systems that secure and govern our data end to end: control access across multiple storage and access layers (including BI tools), track data quality, catalogue datasets and their lineage, detect duplication, audit usage and ensure correct data semantics. ', 'Preferred (not Required)', 'Experience building data backend systems at scale with parallel/distributed compute', 'Experience building API layers and microservices', 'Build the next iteration of our ingestion pipeline for scale, speed, and reliability. Read from a variety of upstream systems (MongoDB, Postgres, DynamoDB, MySQL, APIs), in both batch and streaming fashion, including change data capture. Make it self-service for non-engineers.', 'Responsibilities', 'Experience using data tools and frameworks like Airflow, Spark, Flink, Hadoop, Presto, Hive, or Kafka', 'Knowledge of SQL', ' Exhibit our core cultural values: positive energy, clear communication, efficient execution, continuous learning Experience building data backend systems at scale with parallel/distributed compute Experience using data tools and frameworks like Airflow, Spark, Flink, Hadoop, Presto, Hive, or Kafka Experience with Python, Go and/or Java/Scala A data-oriented mindset ', 'Requirements', 'Exhibit our core cultural values: positive energy, clear communication, efficient execution, continuous learning', 'Experience with Python, Go and/or Java/Scala', ' A resume that describes scalable systems you’ve built ', 'Computer Science or related engineering degree', 'Build and evolve the tools that empower colleagues across the company to access data and build reliable and scalable transformations. This includes UIs and simple frameworks for derived tables and dimensional modeling, APIs and caching layers for high-throughput serving, and SDKs for the orchestration of complex Spark and Flink pipelines.', ' Knowledge of SQL Experience building API layers and microservices Experience with AWS, and especially EMR, S3, Glue, Kinesis, IAM Computer Science or related engineering degree ', 'A data-oriented mindset', 'A resume that describes scalable systems you’ve built', 'Build systems that secure and govern our data end to end: control access across multiple storage and access layers (including BI tools), track data quality, catalogue datasets and their lineage, detect duplication, audit usage and ensure correct data semantics.']

['', 'Nice to haves:', 'Setup a reliable continuous model deployment infrastructure\xa0', 'Setup reliable and secure client data ingestion\xa0', 'Work with Data Scientists to map ML workflows to a scalable platform\xa0', 'Setup reliable and secure client data ingestion\xa0Setup a reliable continuous model deployment infrastructure\xa0Work with Data Scientists to map ML workflows to a scalable platform\xa0Setup centralized data storage to support ease of data access and EDA\xa0Refactor core algorithms for improved efficiency, readability, and test coverage', 'Company Description:', 'Designed and Implemented ML platform used for building and shipping multiple products\xa0Owned, deployed and maintained ETL pipelines in production\xa0Experience in deploying & maintaining distributed learning frameworks (TensorFlow preferred)\xa0Extensive experience in deploying systems on GCP or AWS\xa0Expert developer who uses writes clean, efficient, easy to understand code with unit tests, functional design patterns\xa0Expert in Python 3 and Pandas or equivalent data manipulation library\xa0Expert data architect eager to solve complex, multi dimensional big data problems with advanced strategic leverage of databases, data assets and DAG pipeline\xa0Excellent document writing skills\xa0Extreme creativity and resourcefulness, appetite to solve previously unsolved problems', 'Extreme creativity and resourcefulness, appetite to solve previously unsolved problems', 'Expert data architect eager to solve complex, multi dimensional big data problems with advanced strategic leverage of databases, data assets and DAG pipeline\xa0', "We're transforming big insurance carriers with an AI powered platform that helps catch fraud, make instant decisions, and predict the future. We are pre-series-A, so you'll be joining our founding team!", 'Enthusiasm for team work and pair work\xa0', "We are seeking a senior data engineer who is excited to work on challenging Machine Learning infrastructure problems. ', 'Hands on technical leadership experience leading project teams and setting technical direction. ', 'Deliver reliable compute and storage for use by all Google products and cloud customers.', 'Responsibilities', 'Help build a team and cultivate innovation by driving cross-collaboration and execution of projects across multiple teams. ', 'Manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables with your technical expertise. ['', 'At least 5 years of professional experience in software engineering', 'WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:', 'Streaming / event-driven / CEP architecture, design and implementation', '(Preferred) Fluency in AWS cloud services (Redshift, EKS)', 'Strong Kubernetes fluency (preferably in a GCE environment)', 'Spec, design and build tools and implement platform services to speed up the iteration cycle of machine learning engineers and data scientists, for example:', 'Work extensively with ML engineers and Data Scientists to understand their requirements, pain points, and build generalized solutions.', 'Experience bringing machine learning models into production.', 'This position is a full-time, salaried position. BARK currently has offices in NYC and Columbus, Ohio, but for the right candidates working remotely is also an option. We offer health insurance for both you and your pup, 401k, wonderful team lunches, cold brew on tap, and a dog to pet anytime you wish. ', ' Spec, design and build tools and implement platform services to speed up the iteration cycle of machine learning engineers and data scientists, for example: Kubeflow based ML lifecycle platform Model management, monitoring, and deployment tools Work extensively with ML engineers and Data Scientists to understand their requirements, pain points, and build generalized solutions. Work with product teams to ensure preformant, scalable and secure connectivity between the ML serving platform and products throughout Bark. Spec, design and implement tooling to support the rapid, secure and scalable deployment of Kubernetes services which interface with production systems, including for low-latency use cases. ', 'REQUIREMENTS:', 'BONUS SKILLS:', 'Knowledge of Machine Learning concepts, applications, and libraries; Scikit-learn, Tensorflow', 'Entrepreneurial attitude - self-starter', '(Optional) Fluency in Spark (Pyspark, Databricks, Dataproc)', 'KEY DUTIES:', 'Flexibility to work across different areas: tool building, platform customization, infrastructure optimization, requirements gathering, etc.', '(Optional) Fluency in data lake and data warehouse design, operations and implementation', 'Work with product teams to ensure preformant, scalable and secure connectivity between the ML serving platform and products throughout Bark.', '(Preferred) Fluency in GCP cloud services (GCE, BigQuery, Dataproc, Pub/Sub)', 'WHO WE ARE:', 'Bigtable / HBase information architecture, design and implementation', 'Kubeflow based ML lifecycle platform', ' Experience with Batch Management Systems, such as Airflow or Luigi Knowledge of Machine Learning concepts, applications, and libraries; Scikit-learn, Tensorflow Startup experience at an internet-based company Streaming / event-driven / CEP architecture, design and implementation Bigtable / HBase information architecture, design and implementation ', '(Optional) Experience/familiarity with one of the mature or emerging ML platforms in the industry such as Kubeflow, Google AI Platform, Sagemaker, TFX, MLFlow', 'Strong software design skills', ' (Optional) Experience/familiarity with one of the mature or emerging ML platforms in the industry such as Kubeflow, Google AI Platform, Sagemaker, TFX, MLFlow ', 'ABOUT BARK:', 'Spec, design and implement tooling to support the rapid, secure and scalable deployment of Kubernetes services which interface with production systems, including for low-latency use cases.', ' Experience bringing machine learning models into production. (Optional) Experience/familiarity with one of the mature or emerging ML platforms in the industry such as Kubeflow, Google AI Platform, Sagemaker, TFX, MLFlow  Ability to drive cross-team projects; understand our internal customers (ML practitioners), their common usage patterns and pain points, and design solutions Flexibility to work across different areas: tool building, platform customization, infrastructure optimization, requirements gathering, etc. At least 5 years of professional experience in software engineering Fluency in Python with the ability to write readable, modular, production-quality code Strong Kubernetes fluency (preferably in a GCE environment) Strong software design skills Experience in the end to end design of data engineering solutions Creative problem solver who focuses on improving business and product Entrepreneurial attitude - self-starter (Preferred) Fluency in AWS cloud services (Redshift, EKS) (Preferred) Fluency in GCP cloud services (GCE, BigQuery, Dataproc, Pub/Sub) (Optional) Fluency in Spark (Pyspark, Databricks, Dataproc) (Optional) Fluency in data lake and data warehouse design, operations and implementation ', 'Experience in the end to end design of data engineering solutions', 'Creative problem solver who focuses on improving business and product', 'Model management, monitoring, and deployment tools', 'Startup experience at an internet-based company', 'Ability to drive cross-team projects; understand our internal customers (ML practitioners), their common usage patterns and pain points, and design solutions', 'Experience with Batch Management Systems, such as Airflow or Luigi', 'Fluency in Python with the ability to write readable, modular, production-quality code']

job_title: Remote Senior Big Data Engineer (Python, Apache)
job_text: ['', 'The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.', '• Strong hands on experience in Python and Spark', 'Why Hays?', 'Skills & Requirements', '• Experience in AWS: S3 / EMR / Lambda', 'Drug testing may be required; please contact a recruiter for more information.', '• Participating in meaningful and thorough code reviews.', '• Partner with your peers in Product, Design, Scrum Masters and technology to develop our next gen data infrastructure.', 'Seeking a Remote Senior Big Data Engineer (Python, Apache).', '• Ensure performance, quality and accuracy of our data.', '• You have a strong passion for new technologies and driving innovation.', '• Hands-on software developer with deep technical expertise in Python and Apache Spark', '• Proficient in a Linux environment', '• Delivery of high quality & production ready code is high priority for you.', 'You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there’s a position you really want, you’re fully prepared to get it.', 'Role Description', 'Nervous about an upcoming interview? Unsure how to write a new resume?', 'Hays is an Equal Opportunity Employer.', '• Learning technologies and expanding your skillset is always on your mind.', 'Hays is looking for a Sr. Big Data Engineer who will focus on building out a data lake using AWS Databricks platform. This is a 100% remote role that can sit anywhere in the US. In this role you will work with a team of developers, scrum masters, and business analysts in an Agile environment to make the data on the Big Data Platform accessible for the needs of the organization through Atomic Models and Analytical Data Stores. You will coordinate with a variety of departments to translate high level business requirements into detailed system requirements. You will participate in the entire software development lifecycle by analyzing raw data, writing ETL pipelines in python, and solving data quality issues as they arise during development and after deployment.', '• Experience in Databricks, Delta Lake, Parquet, Hive, and Spark SQL', '• 5+ Years of Python Development in Apache Spark', 'Visit the Hays Career Advice section to learn top tips to help you stand out from the crowd when job hunting.', '• Create and maintain technical documentation.', 'Remote Senior Big Data Engineer (Python, Apache) – Perm - $125,000-$140,000']

This is a ground floor opportunity in a mission and design-driven company; you will have a lot of autonomy, technical leadership, and great impact working closely with the founding and development team to solve interesting technical problems, directly impact people's financial lives, and build a beautiful product.", 'Highly competitive salary+equity compensation package', 'Architecting and developing new product features as well as supporting current ones in our React Native mobile application', 'Familiarity with NoSQL databases', '3+ years experience working in software engineering', 'Good understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms', 'Job Description:', 'Familiarity with Linux / Unix / macOS', 'Required Qualifications:', 'Experience with Cloud Functions (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, etc.)', 'Familiarity with common developer tools and practices (git, code review, CI/CD pipelines, etc.)', 'We are a consumer fintech startup leveraging artificial intelligence to provide financial security and promote money management skills. Our financial planning application is designed to manage credit cards and offer personal loan interest rates to credit card products. Our platform uses advanced AI to translate financial history and spending habits into a highly personalized financial backup plan, enabling users to modify loans and reduce default risks automatically.', 'Company Description:\xa0', 'Proficient in React Native', '3+ years experience working in software engineeringFamiliarity with NoSQL databasesFamiliarity with Linux / Unix / macOSFamiliarity with common developer tools and practices (git, code review, CI/CD pipelines, etc.)Good understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithmsProficient in React NativeHighly passionate and motivated to tackle any technical problem', 'Ensuring high code quality and low technical debt among the engineering team', 'Fully Remote for the foreseeable future, but plan to have an office in the bay area once things settle down, so hopefully candidate is willing to relocate eventually', '401(k) match program']

['', '4 years of experience in an engineering, development, or technical delivery position.', 'Knowledge of .NET system services, communication protocols, or payment industry technologies is a plus.', 'Our engineering teams utilize industry-leading technologies to solve interesting and complicated challenges for our rapidly expanding global payments market. We are relentless in maximizing each individual’s career goals and aspirations, fostering interactions with like-minded people who share the same drive and passion, and allowing the freedom to create your own success. If you are looking for a culture based on engineering excellence, in which your contributions and ideas really make a difference, come join TSYS!', 'BS in Computer Science or related discipline; or commensurate experience is also accepted.', 'Justification', 'Must be teachable, give and receive feedback, and demonstrate success in their discipline on a consistent and transparent basis.', 'What Part Will You Play?', 'Must have in-depth knowledge of Object Oriented Design & Development (OOD) principles in C# or equivalent OOP language as well as API test development, quality engineering, test automation tool sets, and SQL data query language experience.', 'Must be passionate about creating solutions, and solving complex problems – in the right way, at the right time, and for the right reasons.', 'Able to quickly consume and understand business strategy and operating models; can apply gap analysis techniques to create long-term technical strategy; can ensure technical and application capabilities match business needs and goals.', 'Able to effectively communicate goals, metrics, and value propositions across the organization.', 'Must have in-depth knowledge of Object Oriented Design & Development (OOD) principles in C# or equivalent OOP language as well as API test development, quality engineering, test automation tool sets, and SQL data query language experience.4 years of experience in an engineering, development, or technical delivery position.BS in Computer Science or related discipline; or commensurate experience is also accepted.Knowledge of .NET system services, communication protocols, or payment industry technologies is a plus.Able to quickly consume and understand business strategy and operating models; can apply gap analysis techniques to create long-term technical strategy; can ensure technical and application capabilities match business needs and goals.Able to infuse and drive quality engineering best practices and results within Agile iterations using: TDD and BDD methodologies, CI/CD automation pipelines, TQM development models, and QA regression frameworks with test automation.Able to effectively communicate goals, metrics, and value propositions across the organization.Must be teachable, give and receive feedback, and demonstrate success in their discipline on a consistent and transparent basis.Must be passionate about creating solutions, and solving complex problems – in the right way, at the right time, and for the right reasons.', 'Summary', 'What Are We Looking For in This Role?', 'Able to infuse and drive quality engineering best practices and results within Agile iterations using: TDD and BDD methodologies, CI/CD automation pipelines, TQM development models, and QA regression frameworks with test automation.']

job_title: Software Engineer, Perception - Infrastructure and Pipeline
job_text: ['', 'Knowledge of computer architecture and high performance computing is a plus.', 'Experience in Python and SQL.', 'Experience in performance tuning, profiling and tracing (gperf, perf, vtune, etc). ', 'Experience in heterogeneous computing (CUDA, TensorRT, etc).', 'About Pony.ai', 'Experience in low-level optimization (SIMD, compiler, etc).', 'BS/MS in computer science or electrical engineering, or equivalent industry experience. Experience in Python and SQL. Knowledge of computer architecture and high performance computing is a plus. ', ' Experience with multi-processor and multi-threaded environments.  Experience in heterogeneous computing (CUDA, TensorRT, etc). Experience in low-level optimization (SIMD, compiler, etc). Experience in performance tuning, profiling and tracing (gperf, perf, vtune, etc).  Experience in optimizing a large production system with ML models.  ', ' Collaborate with a growing and highly experienced team to create the productive and efficient platform for deploying machine learning and AI applications. Work on the onboard and offboard perception system; design and implement the infrastructure to enable Pony scale to many cities and thousands of cars.  Learn about and design high performance computing (HPC) systems, and how machines and algorithms interact with each other.  ', 'Collaborate with a growing and highly experienced team to create the productive and efficient platform for deploying machine learning and AI applications.', 'Work on the onboard and offboard perception system; design and implement the infrastructure to enable Pony scale to many cities and thousands of cars. ', 'Experience in optimizing a large production system with ML models. ', 'In this role, you will', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Learn about and design high performance computing (HPC) systems, and how machines and algorithms interact with each other. ']

['', 'Previous healthcare experience and domain knowledge', '• 3+ years experience with “Big data” platforms including Hadoop (preferably Azure or GCP) and technologies including Spark, Airflow, Kafka, Hbase, Pig, NoSQL, etc.', '• Proficiency with tools to automate CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GIT, Control-M)', 'At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.', '• Experience executing project in any Agile framework; preferably SAFe', '• Traditional relational data warehouse technologies, such as Oracle, Teradata, or DB2', '• 3+ years experience with Data architecture and data modeling, including creating Semantic Layer Data Models', '• 3+ years experience Developing Metrics and KPI data layers for broader business and analytic consumption', '• Translating analytical problems into structured programs, including PySpark or Scala', 'Required Qualifications', 'We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Math, or related field with 8+ years of professional or business analytics experience; or Master’s Degree with 2+ year of experience in:', 'Business Overview', 'Job Description', '• Preferred: Master’s Degree with coursework focused on advanced algorithms, mathematics in computing, data structures, or related field', '• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Math, or related field; or Advanced Degree', 'The Data Engineer of Big Data will collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders to analyze and synthesize the healthcare related data to meet the insights, reporting dashboard, and descriptive/predictive/prescriptive analytic requirements. You will work on data engineering solutions to leverage best practices and industry leading tools and technologies to profile data, develop efficient ingestion, and build semantic data layers by sourcing data from PBM, Specialty, Retail and HealthCare business.', 'Education', '• Designing data models and solutions for analytical and reporting use cases', '• One of the following languages: PySpark, Scala, or Java', '• SQL, including Analytical SQL functions', 'CVS Health has a rich set of healthcare data of more than 150 million individuals and provides the best foundation for any ambitious data engineer to work on billions of records of healthcare data. The Data Engineer – Big Data, Advisor will lead the build and architecture of next-generation Big Data Machine Learning framework developed on a group of core Hadoop technologies. You will lead the design of highly scalable and extensible data platform including but not limited to RDBMS / Big Data / Cloud, which enables industrializing collection, storage, modeling, and analysis of massive data sets from heterogeneous channels.', 'You will conduct proof of concept work on Teradata, Azure, and/or GCP to design data solutions to explore data, understand the grain and relationship of the data entities, and attributes to implement robust analytic and reporting solutions. You need to have a thorough understanding of SAFe agile framework, DevOps, and how to operationalize and automate the data pipelines on Teradata and/or Big Data environments on on-prem/Cloud environments. You will be primarily responsible for designing conformed, aggregated, and semantic data layers, and manipulating large datasets to support insights and analytics using SQL, BTEQ, SAS, and similar tools.', 'Preferred Qualifications']

['', ' BS, in Computer Science or related technical discipline (or equivalent).  2 years of experience in software design and web development  Experience with AWS, RDS, Lambda, Node.js, API Web Gateway  Experience with .NET, SPA, and service oriented architecture  Experience with build automation and code repository tools (i.e. Jenkins, Git, Maven)  Familiarity with SQL, database object creation, and stored procedures  Experience with Agile software development methodology Demonstrate continuous software development capabilities  What we offer  Comprehensive benefits package include medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, 401k savings plan, retirement plan, paid time off, transit benefit, onsite gym and subsidized cafeteria  A continuous learning environment with opportunities to gain new skills and grow your careerRequirements Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.  As a condition of employment, Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago employees must comply with the Bank’s ethics rules, which generally prohibit employees, their spouses/domestic partners, and minor children from owning securities, such as stock, of banks or savings associations or their affiliates, such as bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies. If you or your spouse/domestic partner or minor child own such securities, and would not be willing or able to divest them if you accepted an offer of Bank employment, you should raise this issue with the recruiter for this posting, who can provide you contact information for our ethics official if necessary. Prepares and completes the design of components or portions of moderately complex functional systems, working from overall operations, functional, quality, and similar design requirements. job_title: Data Scientist, Technology and Products Group
job_text: ['', ' Develop machine learning algorithms, automated processes, and software using large datasets from multiple disparate sources ', 'Education And Experience', ' Masters or PhD and several years of industry experience majoring in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, or equivalent ', 'Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. ', ' Strong understanding and application of Machine Learning algorithms ', ' Collaborate with peers globally to establish Best Known Methods (BKMs) for standards, efficiency, and deployment ', ' Experience in Semiconductor Design, Product Engineering, or Manufacturing flows preferred ', ' Masters or PhD and several years of industry experience majoring in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, or equivalent  Semiconductor industry experience and/or knowledge preferred ', 'About Micron Technology, Inc.', ' Drive action through effective data presentation and data story telling ', ' Strong understanding and application of Machine Learning algorithms  Experienced in modern Machine Learning libraries and in working with high dimensional, skewed and frequently changing datasets  Proficient in Python and/or R, in PySpark and/or SparkR, and in executing data extraction from variety of data sources (Teradata, Snowflake, Oracle, MS SQL)  Ability to design and coordinate projects across multiple departments globally  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Experience in Semiconductor Design, Product Engineering, or Manufacturing flows preferred  Experience in statistical modeling and feature extraction desired  Experience in Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, and HBase desired ', ' Strong verbal and written communication skills ', 'Responsibilities', ' Enabling advanced modeling and algorithm development across a broad spectrum of problems to accelerate process and product technology solutions and decision making. ', ' Collaborate with functional engineers, data scientists, data engineers, business areas engineers to develop well-defined problem statements to challenging problems  Develop machine learning algorithms, automated processes, and software using large datasets from multiple disparate sources  Collaborate with peers globally to establish Best Known Methods (BKMs) for standards, efficiency, and deployment  Drive action through effective data presentation and data story telling ', 'Qualifications', ' Proficient in Python and/or R, in PySpark and/or SparkR, and in executing data extraction from variety of data sources (Teradata, Snowflake, Oracle, MS SQL) ', 'The Team Has Two Focus Areas', ' Experience in statistical modeling and feature extraction desired ', ' Collaborate with functional engineers, data scientists, data engineers, business areas engineers to develop well-defined problem statements to challenging problems ', ' Experience in Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, and HBase desired ', ' Ability to design and coordinate projects across multiple departments globally ', ' Semiconductor industry experience and/or knowledge preferred ', ' Using vast streams of data (structured and unstructured) and developing intelligence around these data streams to help technology and product development engineers develop semiconductor solutions faster. ', ' Experienced in modern Machine Learning libraries and in working with high dimensional, skewed and frequently changing datasets ']

['At Scribd (pronounced\xa0“scribbed”), we believe reading is more important than ever. Join our cast of unique characters as we build the world’s largest and most fascinating digital library: giving subscribers access to a growing collection of ebooks, audiobooks, magazines, documents, and more.', '', 'The role', 'The responsibilities include:', '• Analyzing uploaded documents for copyright infringement, spam, and other quality checks.\xa0', 'Our community includes over 1M subscribers in more than 190 countries. Join us in turning screen time into quality time!', 'At this time the role will start as full-time remote, as all of our employees are working from home. When everyone is able to return to the office this role is available at our new office in San Francisco or in our Toronto office. This position can also be fully remote for candidates with experience leading development remotely.', '• Managing all aspects of technical project delivery, including system and architectural design, project planning, implementation, deployment, and operations.', '• 10+ years of experience as a professional software engineer', "Scribd's ability to surface more relevant, topical, and personalized content hinges on our ability to understand the content of each book, audiobook, article, and uploaded document. The output and success of the Content Understanding team is a strategic pillar of Scribd's future growth.", 'In addition to works from major publishers and top authors, we also create our own original content exclusively for Scribd users.', '• Bachelor’s in CS or equivalent professional experience', 'Want to learn more? Check out our office and meet some of the team at\xa0https://www.scribd.com/about', "As the Lead Software Engineer of the Content Understanding team, your job will be to provide hands-on technical leadership across all of the team's in-progress work as well as the team's technical roadmap.", "The Content Understanding team's mission is to provide accurate and up-to-date metadata about Scribd's content as a means towards enabling better product experiences for Scribd users.", "Our technical work is divided between our online Rails application and our offline Databricks environment. Many of the systems we're responsible for span both environments, so engineers regularly work within both. Though the tech stacks differ between environments, the engineering work in both is the same - create data pipelines to ingest, process, clean, and layout the metadata coming from publishers and other external sources, as well as create new metadata from our vast content base.", '• Ensuring consistency of design, adherence to Scribd engineering principles and practices, and operational excellence across all team work.', 'If these responsibilities match your interests (and excludes responsibilities you have no desire to perform) then you should apply!', '• Exposing all documents to search indexers through sitemaps.\xa0', "• Working closely with the team's Engineering Manager to prioritize technical projects and improvements relative to requested feature work.", "As the responsibilities demonstrate, the Lead Software Engineer role is more than just an advanced IC role. It is a hands-on leadership role, where you will balance the responsibilities of project work with technical team leadership. Your years of experience allow you to give guidance on projects you aren't deeply familiar with and quickly diagnose root causes of bugs. You and the Engineering Manager will be a team, with your expertise and ability to handle daily technical blockers enabling the Engineering Manager to focus on interviewing and hiring, people management, and project planning.", 'Requirements', '• Leading the design, implementation, and delivery of your primary project.', 'Scribd is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.', "The team is a team first. We work collaboratively, not as engineers working on individual projects in silos. We continually strive for inclusivity and strongly value diversity. We recognize that everyone has a unique set of work and life experiences, and believe that a broader set of perspectives will produce better results for all. Each day provides both opportunities to perform and opportunities to learn. We support others' growth and celebrate our collective achievements.", "The team is split between our San Francisco headquarters and our Toronto office. We use tools that emphasize asynchronous communication (Slack, Github, Jira, Google Docs) but will also pair program or jump into a meeting room when those are the best approaches. Regardless of the medium, excellent communication skills are a must. We operate with autonomy (developers closest to the code will make the most well-informed decisions) while holding ourselves and each other accountable for using good judgement when faced with each day's unique challenges.", "• Developing a long term roadmap for evolving team systems to support orders of magnitude growth of Scribd's subscribers, user uploads, and publisher content.", 'Our team', 'The work includes:', '• Building and maintaining systems that link documents to Scribd’s taxonomy and other classification systems.\xa0', '• Experience managing multiple projects or a strong desire to take on these new responsibilities• Deep knowledge of common data architectures and industry technologies', '• Being a presence that makes every engineer on the team better.', '• Building and maintaining metadata extraction pipelines, document metadata storage, and APIs that expose metadata to other Scribd systems.', '• 3+ years experience working with data pipelines', 'Office or remote?', 'We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.']

['', 'You have a product-focused mindset. ', 'We have dozens of individual, mission-focused teams working across a wide spectrum of technological challenges. You will have the opportunity, depending on your interests and aptitude, to work on large-scale distributed systems coordinating thousands of servers in cloud and physical data centers around the world, petabyte-scale data challenges, machine learning, advanced visualizations, and interactive user interfaces – to name a few.', 'You are a creative thinker, ', 'You work with confidence and without ego.Our engineers have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of leadership in their daily work. You have strongly-held, defensible ideas, and advocate for what you believe is right. You are also adept at identifying and evaluating trade-offs, willing to be proven wrong, and quick to walk through fire to support your fellow teammates. ', 'You are a broadly skilled engineer , accustomed to developing web services. You have experience building always-on systems, working across a variety of technologies and service layers. ', 'Who We Are Looking For: ', 'You work with confidence and without ego.', 'You understand engineering fundamentals.', 'Our Engineers are end-to-end owners. You will participate actively in all aspects of designing, building, and delivering products for our clients.', 'Our Engineers are end-to-end owners. You will participate actively in all aspects of designing, building, and delivering products for our clients.We have dozens of individual, mission-focused teams working across a wide spectrum of technological challenges. ', 'You are a broadly skilled engineer', 'You have a product-focused mindset. You have the passion and ability to contribute to the process of discovering what will delight our clients and push forward one of the world’s largest and most influential industries toward a vision of openness, transparency, and evidence-based decision-making. ', 'You value, seek out, and foster diversity.', 'Senior Engineers contribute to more than our product – they build up our team. Through a combination of mentoring, technical leadership, and/or direct management of small teams, they make others better and raise the bar for those around them. ', 'You have a sustained track record of making significant, self-directed, and end-to-end contributions to large and impactful software projects. You think beyond just the task at hand to deeply understand the \'why\' behind what you are doing. You understand engineering fundamentals.At our scale, many off-the-shelf techniques and existing technologies (open source and enterprise) simply don\'t work. You are able to work from first principles to evaluate solutions and adapt them to a unique environment. You are a broadly skilled engineer , accustomed to developing web services. You have experience building always-on systems, working across a variety of technologies and service layers. You have a product-focused mindset. You have the passion and ability to contribute to the process of discovering what will delight our clients and push forward one of the world’s largest and most influential industries toward a vision of openness, transparency, and evidence-based decision-making. You work with confidence and without ego.Our engineers have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of leadership in their daily work. You have strongly-held, defensible ideas, and advocate for what you believe is right. You are also adept at identifying and evaluating trade-offs, willing to be proven wrong, and quick to walk through fire to support your fellow teammates. You value, seek out, and foster diversity.We are a global team from many diverse backgrounds, with different experiences and perspectives. To complement this team, you will welcome ideas that are different from your own and be skilled at finding and building from common ground. You are a creative thinker, not bound by "the way things have always been done". What you know is less important than how well you learn and innovate. We don\'t need engineers who know all the answers; we need engineers who can invent the answers no one has thought of yet, to the questions yet to be asked. job_text: ['', ' Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment. ', "Bachelor's with 0-1 years of experience or a Master's degree with 0 years of experience is required.", ' Familiar with existing deep learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2) and machine learning packages (i.e. sklearn) Experience applying machine learning and artificial intelligence to domain specific applications, such as geospatial intelligence, natural language processing, few-shot learning, adversarial machine learning, social computing, computer vision, etc. Ability to contribute that knowledge to the academic and research strength of PNNL and have experience writing scientific publications demonstrating their insight and discovery. job_title: Site Reliability Engineer (fka - Big Data/Cloud Engineer)
job_text: ['', ' Practice sustainable incident response as part of an on-call rotation and through blameless postmortems.', ' Engage in and improve the software development lifecycle - from inception and design, through development, deployment, operation and refinement for greater reliability. Influence and design infrastructure, architecture, standards and methods for large-scale systems. Support services prior to production via infrastructure design, software platform development, load testing, capacity planning and launch reviews. Maintain services during deployment and in production by measuring and monitoring key performance and service level indicators including availability, latency, and overall system health. Automate system scalability and continually work to improve system resiliency, performance and efficiency. Practice sustainable incident response as part of an on-call rotation and through blameless postmortems. Remediate tasks within corrective action plan via sustainable, preventative, and automated measures whenever possible.', ' Experience developing and/or administering software in cloud infrastructure.', ' Remediate tasks within corrective action plan via sustainable, preventative, and automated measures whenever possible.', ' Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.', ' Demonstrable cross-functional knowledge with systems, storage, networking, security and databases.', ' Maintain services during deployment and in production by measuring and monitoring key performance and service level indicators including availability, latency, and overall system health.', ' Influence and design infrastructure, architecture, standards and methods for large-scale systems.', ' BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent practical experience.', ' Experience managing Infrastructure as code via tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.', ' Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.', ' BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent practical experience. Experience developing and/or administering software in cloud infrastructure. 2+ years experience in GCP. Experience in monitoring infrastructure and application uptime and availability to ensure functional and performance objectives. 5-7 years of experience in languages such as Python, Ruby, Bash, PHP, Perl, javascript and/or node.js. Experience managing Infrastructure as code via tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation. Demonstrable cross-functional knowledge with systems, storage, networking, security and databases. System administration skills, including automation and orchestration of Linux/Windows using Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt Stack and/or containers (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.). Proficiency with continuous integration and continuous delivery tooling and practices. Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.', ' Expertise designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems. Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive. Experience building software or maintaining systems in a highly secure, regulated or compliant industry. Experience and passion for working within a DevOps culture and as part of a team.', 'Responsibilities', ' Engage in and improve the software development lifecycle - from inception and design, through development, deployment, operation and refinement for greater reliability.', ' 5-7 years of experience in languages such as Python, Ruby, Bash, PHP, Perl, javascript and/or node.js.', 'Job Description', ' Experience and passion for working within a DevOps culture and as part of a team.', ' Proficiency with continuous integration and continuous delivery tooling and practices.', ' Expertise designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.', ' System administration skills, including automation and orchestration of Linux/Windows using Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt Stack and/or containers (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.).', ' Experience in monitoring infrastructure and application uptime and availability to ensure functional and performance objectives.', ' Experience building software or maintaining systems in a highly secure, regulated or compliant industry.', ' Support services prior to production via infrastructure design, software platform development, load testing, capacity planning and launch reviews.', ' Automate system scalability and continually work to improve system resiliency, performance and efficiency.', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' 2+ years experience in GCP.']

['', 'Corporate social responsibility initiatives with global reach', 'You’re passionate about machine learning and have a good understanding of statistics and Machine Learning in general', 'You have a strong analytical background and we prefer you have a Master degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science/Mathematics/Physics/etc.', 'You also support our learning culture by sharing your state-of-the-art knowledge through internal and external presentations', 'You are an experienced back-end/full-stack developer so you can take models into production. ', 'You are proficient in Java/Python, experience with Scala and Apache Spark are a bonus', 'An opportunity to work with a diverse, global community of 600+ Collibrians across 18 countries, united by our value of open, direct, and kind', 'You love challenges and problem solving and have no fear for the unknown', ' You play a key role in bringing ML/AI to production working on your own models and those produced by team members. You work closely together with other engineering teams to help them build awesome product features using your models You help drive best practices when it comes to AI/ML development as well as code standards You put appropriate metrics in place for the models and make sure we can track them. Observability is the only way to succeed in your opinion! You don’t stop at delivering AI models to our engineering teams. You have a high impact on our data-intelligence platform by being an internal user. You use our catalog to track model input data as well as govern our models and show the path for model governance. You also support our learning culture by sharing your state-of-the-art knowledge through internal and external presentations You build microservices in Java/Scala/Python that are deployed via Docker/Kubernetes We also use technologies like Apache Spark, Keras, TensorFlow, etc. GCP and AWS are home to most of our work but we are also working on the ‘Edge’You work in a very diverse team of AI engineers, AI experts and Machine Learning operations engineers because we deliver end-to-end MLaaS solutions to our stake Everything we do is continuously delivered so all your commits are ready-for-production ', 'A culture of company-wide collaboration and shared success. ', 'You have broad interest in data related technologies (e.g. K8s, TensorFlow, PyTorch, ....) and are comfortable getting used to them', 'Team building, bonding, mentorship and support to grow confidence, trust and friendships', 'A flexible culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity', 'You understand that building AI-driven features is a team-effort that entails much more than training a model', 'You are Agile-minded, have a positive mindset and put quality first', 'Inclusive benefits package allowing enrollment of dependents and partners', 'You build microservices in Java/Scala/Python that are deployed via Docker/Kubernetes', 'You help drive best practices when it comes to AI/ML development as well as code standards', 'You put appropriate metrics in place for the models and make sure we can track them. Observability is the only way to succeed in your opinion!', 'You play a key role in bringing ML/AI to production working on your own models and those produced by team members. You work closely together with other engineering teams to help them build awesome product features using your models', ' You are an experienced back-end/full-stack developer so you can take models into production.  You are proficient in Java/Python, experience with Scala and Apache Spark are a bonus You have a strong analytical background and we prefer you have a Master degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science/Mathematics/Physics/etc. You’re passionate about machine learning and have a good understanding of statistics and Machine Learning in general You can easily find, process and clean data for any project You have broad interest in data related technologies (e.g. K8s, TensorFlow, PyTorch, ....) and are comfortable getting used to them Having solid knowledge of relational databases and other database technologies (NoSQL, Graph databases …) are a great plus. You love challenges and problem solving and have no fear for the unknown You are Agile-minded, have a positive mindset and put quality first You understand that building AI-driven features is a team-effort that entails much more than training a model ', 'Learning and development programs to advance your career and personal growth', ' Competitive compensation, and private company equity  Inclusive benefits package allowing enrollment of dependents and partners A flexible culture that understands the importance of quality of work over quantity An opportunity to work with a diverse, global community of 600+ Collibrians across 18 countries, united by our value of open, direct, and kind A culture of company-wide collaboration and shared success.  Company supported and employee driven resource groups that promote diversity, career development and empowerment Learning and development programs to advance your career and personal growth Corporate social responsibility initiatives with global reach Regular recognition, feedback, and open communication across all levels Team building, bonding, mentorship and support to grow confidence, trust and friendships ', 'We Offer', 'Regular recognition, feedback, and open communication across all levels', "How You'll Make An Impact At Collibra", 'You can easily find, process and clean data for any project', 'Company supported and employee driven resource groups that promote diversity, career development and empowerment', 'Competitive compensation, and private company equity ', 'You Have', 'You don’t stop at delivering AI models to our engineering teams. You have a high impact on our data-intelligence platform by being an internal user. You use our catalog to track model input data as well as govern our models and show the path for model governance.', 'GCP and AWS are home to most of our work but we are also working on the ‘Edge’You work in a very diverse team of AI engineers, AI experts and Machine Learning operations engineers because we deliver end-to-end MLaaS solutions to our stake Everything we do is continuously delivered so all your commits are ready-for-production', 'Having solid knowledge of relational databases and other database technologies (NoSQL, Graph databases …) are a great plus.', 'We also use technologies like Apache Spark, Keras, TensorFlow, etc.']

job_text: ['', 'Work in an agile software development environment collaborating with engineering team to analyze requirements specifications and discuss software design and testability to ensure we deliver high quality of software.', 'Understand how all elements of the application technology stack work together, evaluate functional and design specifications and develop testing approaches and strategies that fit the overall quality objectives', 'Analyze and report bugs, and work with software engineers to resolve them', 'Passionate about analyzing, isolating, and solving problems.', 'Proficiency with Java', 'Partner with quality engineering teams to ideate on tooling that enables improving testing efficiency, reliability and accelerates the deployment cycles', 'Promote culture of test automation by exploring and identifying test automaton opportunities at all layers (unit, integration, UI) of the application stack', 'Proficiency in SQL and database concepts', 'Experience working in agile frameworks (Scrum/Kanban)', ' Work in an agile software development environment collaborating with engineering team to analyze requirements specifications and discuss software design and testability to ensure we deliver high quality of software. Understand how all elements of the application technology stack work together, evaluate functional and design specifications and develop testing approaches and strategies that fit the overall quality objectives Consistently apply end-user mindset to evaluate technical implementation and formulate & execute high quality test plans to provide enriched experience to our website visitors Design and develop robust test automation class libraries for UI, integrations, and API layers of the application stack Maintain automated regression suites/packages to be compliant with changing requirements and features Actively participate in functional, system and regression testing Analyze and report bugs, and work with software engineers to resolve them Partner with quality engineering teams to ideate on tooling that enables improving testing efficiency, reliability and accelerates the deployment cycles Promote culture of test automation by exploring and identifying test automaton opportunities at all layers (unit, integration, UI) of the application stack ', 'Job Summary', ' Excellent understanding of software quality principles and processes Demonstrated experience in analyzing functional requirements and authoring comprehensive testing strategies, test plans for complex application architecture  Automated GUI testing experience with Java testing solutions such as Selenium or JavaScript testing solutions such as Cypress, Puppeteer, etc. Proficient in functional testing and automation of RESTful APIs  Experience working with build tools such as Maven (Java/Groovy), Gulp (JavaScript)  Familiarity with source code management and CI/CD tools such as GitLab, Jenkins  Passionate about analyzing, isolating, and solving problems. Experience working in agile frameworks (Scrum/Kanban) Good written and verbal communication skills Experience with testing and automating web services and Java APIs Proficiency in SQL and database concepts', 'Good written and verbal communication skills', 'Maintain automated regression suites/packages to be compliant with changing requirements and features', 'Responsibilities', 'Excellent understanding of software quality principles and processes', 'Experience with testing and automating web services and Java APIs', 'Proficient in functional testing and automation of RESTful APIs ', "A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree, or equivalent experience) is required.", 'Design and develop robust test automation class libraries for UI, integrations, and API layers of the application stack', 'Familiarity with source code management and CI/CD tools such as GitLab, Jenkins ', 'Additional Qualifications', "A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree, or equivalent experience) is required. Proficiency with Java ", 'Actively participate in functional, system and regression testing', 'Demonstrated experience in analyzing functional requirements and authoring comprehensive testing strategies, test plans for complex application architecture ', 'Experience working with build tools such as Maven (Java/Groovy), Gulp (JavaScript) ', 'Consistently apply end-user mindset to evaluate technical implementation and formulate & execute high quality test plans to provide enriched experience to our website visitors', 'Automated GUI testing experience with Java testing solutions such as Selenium or JavaScript testing solutions such as Cypress, Puppeteer, etc.', 'Minimum Qualifications']

['', 'Flexible work location opportunities\xa0', 'Company-paid medical and dental insurance benefits for you and your dependents', 'Discogs is the largest community-driven database of music information in the world and a marketplace facilitator. Every day, millions of people use the Discogs Marketplace to connect and learn about music, as well as buy and sell vinyl records, CDs, and cassettes. As Discogs continues to grow, we are looking for bright, dedicated, creative, and highly motivated people to help us realize the mission of Discogs: to serve the music fan in everyone.', 'Coach and mentor other team members by providing recommendations, technical oversight, code reviews, and feedback.', 'Who We Are', "Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university in math/computer science, computer engineering, related field, or equivalent work experience.\xa0", 'Extensive experience working with production systems; troubleshooting, performance tuning, optimizing, refactoring, etc.', '10+ years of related work experience.', 'The Senior Software Engineer will work as a member of the backend Marketplace team supporting eCommerce features of the Discogs Marketplace. This role requires extensive experience with Python, MySQL, and Docker. This role also requires knowledge of Git, Git Workflow, and agile development. Experience with the Oscar eCommerce platform, Javascript and React in this role would be a plus.', 'If you apply for this role, you will be required to upload a resume, cover letter, and fill out a few questions regarding your application. Once submitted, our hiring team will review your application and contact you if you are selected for an interview. Whether you are successful or not, we will store your application and data in our system for a maximum period of one year from the application date in case another role becomes available that you are suitable for. If you have any questions or concerns about us storing this data and/or the period of time, please contact us at legal@discogsinc.com and we will respond to you within 30 days.', "What We're Looking For", 'Compensation, Benefits, and Perks', 'Design, develop, and maintain various applications and services that comprise our Discogs platform.Coach and mentor other team members by providing recommendations, technical oversight, code reviews, and feedback.Collaborate closely with Product Management and with other Engineering Teams to quickly deliver high-quality products that maximize value to the Discogs ecosystem.Develops and maintains front end and back end software following an Agile/Scrum methodology.Collaborates with squad members on troubleshooting and creating elegant solutions to complex problems.Communicates effectively with tech and non-tech members and is capable of delivering feedback to peers and their leaders.Assists squad with estimation and prioritization of development efforts.Actively engages with members of cross-functional, product-focused squads to build a variety of features and services.Coaches and mentors other engineers by providing recommendations, technical oversight, code reviews, and feedback.Capable of delivering small-to-medium features all the way through from technical design to launch with no guidance.', 'Develops and maintains front end and back end software following an Agile/Scrum methodology.', 'Monthly wellness allowance', 'Qualifications and Experience', 'Competitive compensation: salary, performance-related bonus program, and 401(k) match4 weeks’ paid vacation, holidays, and maternity/paternity leaveCompany-paid medical and dental insurance benefits for you and your dependentsMonthly wellness allowanceAnnual professional development allowanceWork from home office set-up and expense allowances\xa0Flexible work location opportunities\xa0Work-life balance is key to our success', 'Responsibilities', 'Communicates effectively with tech and non-tech members and is capable of delivering feedback to peers and their leaders.', 'Design, develop, and maintain various applications and services that comprise our Discogs platform.', 'Deep understanding of Software Engineering processes such as version control, build and configuration management, automated deployments, automated testing, etc.', 'Work from home office set-up and expense allowances\xa0', 'Assists squad with estimation and prioritization of development efforts.', '1+ years experience in a technical lead role.', 'Actively engages with members of cross-functional, product-focused squads to build a variety of features and services.', 'Work-life balance is key to our success', 'Annual professional development allowance', 'We are relatively small, so individual contributions can have a large impact. High value is placed on quality, critical thinking, and continuous improvement. Our teams work collaboratively but are distributed geographically and open-source tools are important to who we are and how we work. We value the experiences and skills each team member contributes to helping us serve our music community.', 'Knowledge of Javascript, React and the Oscar eCommerce platform would be a plus.', 'We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer located in Portland, Oregon to join our Marketplace Team within our Engineering department. The ideal candidate will be excited about solving complex issues, mentoring others, and who thinks outside the box in order to find innovative solutions.', "Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university in math/computer science, computer engineering, related field, or equivalent work experience.\xa010+ years of related work experience.1+ years experience in a technical lead role.Extensive experience working with production systems; troubleshooting, performance tuning, optimizing, refactoring, etc.Extensive experience with Python, MySQL, Docker, and Git.Deep understanding of Software Engineering processes such as version control, build and configuration management, automated deployments, automated testing, etc.Knowledge of Javascript, React and the Oscar eCommerce platform would be a plus.", '4 weeks’ paid vacation, holidays, and maternity/paternity leave', 'Discogs is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants needing\xa0accommodation to apply should contact us at 503-597-6340.', 'Competitive compensation: salary, performance-related bonus program, and 401(k) match', 'Coaches and mentors other engineers by providing recommendations, technical oversight, code reviews, and feedback.', 'Capable of delivering small-to-medium features all the way through from technical design to launch with no guidance.', 'Collaborate closely with Product Management and with other Engineering Teams to quickly deliver high-quality products that maximize value to the Discogs ecosystem.', 'Extensive experience with Python, MySQL, Docker, and Git.', 'Collaborates with squad members on troubleshooting and creating elegant solutions to complex problems.']

job_title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Advanced Engineering
job_text: ['Create/identify new ideas from conception to inception', '\xa0The minimum requirements we seek:\xa0', 'At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.', 'Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.\xa0Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.\xa0', 'Java/.Net development', 'The minimum requirements we seek:', 'Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop interfaces across the vehicle, cloud, and appDevelop system architecture and complex interfacesCreate/identify new ideas from conception to inceptionParticipate in new idea development processesCreate flexible, scalable, and re-usable software functions that exceed user expectationsGenerate intellectual property (IP), trademarks, and patents\xa0', 'Open-source software experience', 'Ability to optimize interfaces to improve system performance', 'Create flexible, scalable, and re-usable software functions that exceed user expectations', 'In-depth knowledge of software development tools', 'Cloud environments (e.g., PCF, Azure, AWS)', 'Our preferred requirements:\xa0\xa0', 'Develop system architecture and complex interfaces', 'Proven creativity with strong commitment to quality and innovation', 'Familiarity with mobile app architecture, code refactoring, code optimization, and security techniques\xa0', 'If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we’d love to have you join us.', 'What you’ll be able to do:', 'Our preferred requirements:', 'Embedded systems development (e.g., C, C++, Python)\xa0', 'Generate intellectual property (IP), trademarks, and patents\xa0', 'Background in rapid prototype developmentIn-depth knowledge of software development toolsProven creativity with strong commitment to quality and innovationKnowledge of failure mode analysis tools and error state mitigation techniquesExceptional communication, interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skillsOpen-source software experienceExperience with wireless protocols (e.g., BLE, WiFi, NFC, etc.)Ability to optimize interfaces to improve system performanceUnderstanding of connected vehicle ecosystem and mobile development (ios/android)Knowledge of in-vehicle architectures, CAN messaging, and web servicesExperience setting up a development environment, creating testing tools and automation softwareFamiliarity with mobile app architecture, code refactoring, code optimization, and security techniques\xa0', 'Experience with wireless protocols (e.g., BLE, WiFi, NFC, etc.)', 'Bachelor’s degree', 'Our Research and Advanced Engineering team explores how new vehicle and societal innovations can be creatively applied to our products and services. The team is building on a history of Ford innovation, including the three-way catalytic converter that modernized vehicle emissions controls in the 1970s and the world’s first rear inflatable seat belts in 2010.\xa0Today, we are devising and delivering smarter vehicles and more efficient transportation systems to improve people’s lives by helping them move more freely, safely and enjoyably. We are changing how our products are made by creating high-quality vehicles in an environmentally and socially-responsible way, including the use of sustainable materials. Since 2000, we have used 12 industry- and world-first plant-based materials in our production vehicles. We also are researching the possible use of tomato skin, bamboo, agave fiber, dandelion roots, algae and coffee chaff as part of our ambitious goal of making our vehicles with up of 20 percent sustainable material by 2025.', 'Experience setting up a development environment, creating testing tools and automation software', 'By choice, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.', 'Knowledge of failure mode analysis tools and error state mitigation techniques', 'Background in rapid prototype development', 'Participate in new idea development processes', 'Bachelor’s degreeTwo or more years of full stack development experience with expertise in:Java/.Net developmentCloud environments (e.g., PCF, Azure, AWS)Embedded systems development (e.g., C, C++, Python)\xa0API/microservice development\xa0Two or more years of experience with TDD and Agile methodologies\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'Two or more years of experience with TDD and Agile methodologies\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'API/microservice development\xa0', 'Knowledge of in-vehicle architectures, CAN messaging, and web services', 'Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop interfaces across the vehicle, cloud, and app', 'As a key member of our Advanced Engineering Delivery Team, you will help identify, analyze and develop next generation connected vehicle software platforms and systems. This will involve collaborating with the Advanced Engineering product owners and Engineering teams to deliver advanced prototypes and pilot programs. You will:\xa0', '\xa0', 'Understanding of connected vehicle ecosystem and mobile development (ios/android)', 'Exceptional communication, interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills', 'Two or more years of full stack development experience with expertise in:', 'As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.', 'What you’ll receive in return:']

Reviews project deliverables such as specifications, code, and test/tool procedures for feasibility, thoroughness, clarity, correctness, and accuracy. Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments.  Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors. ']
